section.title: Form/CampUtil
FrostUtil/GetAPIVersion
section.para: Get the FrostUtil API version number.
None
The FrostUtil API version number. This is NOT the same thing as the version number of Frostfall. FrostUtil's API version number will increment only when changes have been made to the API itself.

section.title: FrostUtil/GetFrostfallVersion
section.para: Get the Frostfall mod version number.
None
The Frostfall version number.

section.title: FrostUtil/IsPlayerNearFire
section.para: Whether or not the player is currently near a fire. Note:
None
True if near a fire; false otherwise.
section.literallayout: ;Is the player near a fire? bool near_fire = FrostUtil.IsPlayerNearFire()
section.para: This does NOT indicate if the player is near a heat source; there are heat sources that are not fires. Fires have special properties in Frostfall and Campfire, which include drying the player when wet, and being able to cook food using a cooking pot.
To determine if the player is near a heat source of any kind, use GetPlayerHeatSourceLevel() instead.

section.title: FrostUtil/GetPlayerHeatSourceLevel
section.para: The level (size) of the player's current nearby heat source.
None
Possible return values:

listitem.para: 0 = Player is not near a heat source.
1 = Current heat source is "small" (e.g. bowls of burning embers, "fragile" campfires in Campfire)
2 = Current heat source is "medium" (e.g. most campfires and other fireplaces)
3 = Current heat source is "large" (e.g. giant campfires, "roaring" campfires in Campfire)

section.literallayout: ;Is the player near heat? int heat = FrostUtil.GetPlayerHeatSourceLevel() if heat > 0 debug.notification("Player is near a heat source!") endif
section.para: This function does NOT determine if the heat source is a fire or not; there are heat sources that are not fires. To determine if the player is near a fire, use IsPlayerNearFire().

section.title: FrostUtil/GetPlayerHeatSourceDistance
section.para: The distance from the player to the player's current nearby heat source.
None

listitem.para: 0.0 to 600.0 - The distance from the player to the heat source. Frostfall does not detect heat sources more than 600 units away.

section.literallayout: ;How far away is the heat source? float dist = FrostUtil.GetPlayerHeatSourceDistance() if dist <= 300.0 debug.notification("The player is really close to the heat source!") endif

section.title: FrostUtil/IsPlayerTakingShelter
section.para: Whether or not the player is taking shelter underneath an outcropping / building. If the player is "sheltered", the player will dry off if wet, regardless of current weather conditions.
None
True if taking shelter, false if not.
section.literallayout: ;Is the player underneath something? bool sheltered = FrostUtil.IsPlayerTakingShelter()
section.para: This function does not return true if the player is inside a Campfire-based tent; it only returns true if a ray emitting upward from the player's head collides with an obstruction. For tent detection, use CampUtil.GetCurrentTent().

section.title: FrostUtil/IsNearFastTravelException
section.para: Whether or not the player near a "fast travel exception". If a player is nearby one of these objects, the Exposure System will re-enable the player's Fast Travel controls. This is used in cases where there is an expectation for Fast Travel be enabled when near these objects (like Apocrypha's Black Books.)
None
True if near a "fast travel exception" object, false if not.
section.literallayout: ;Is the player near a fast travel exception? bool near_ft_exception = FrostUtil.IsNearFastTravelException()

section.title: FrostUtil/GetCurrentTemperature
section.para: Returns the current area temperature, based on location, weather, weather severity, and time of day.
None

listitem.para: Greater than 10: A "warm" area. Exposure will decrease. The higher the number, the faster it will decrease.
10: A "neutral" area. Exposure will not increase or decrease.
Less than 10: A "cold" area. Exposure will increase. The lower the number, the faster it will increase.

section.literallayout: int temp = FrostUtil.GetCurrentTemperature() if temp < 10 debug.notification("It's cold!") endif
section.para: The return values of this function correspond very roughly with degrees celsius.

section.title: FrostUtil/GetCurrentWeatherActual
section.para: Returns the current weather somewhat more accurately than the default GetCurrentWeather() function. This function returns the outgoing weather if the weather is currently transitioning out (and thus is still currently visible). Otherwise, returns the current weather.
None
The current weather.
section.literallayout: ;What is the current weather, really? Weather wthr = FrostUtil.GetCurrentWeatherActual()

section.title: FrostUtil/GetWeatherClassificationActual
section.para: Returns the classification of the weather returned by GetCurrentWeatherActual().
The current weather classification.
section.literallayout: ;What is the current weather classification, really? int class = FrostUtil.GetWeatherClassificationActual()

section.title: FrostUtil/IsWeatherSevere
section.para: True if this weather is in the severe weather list that Frostfall maintains, false if not.
Whether or not this weather is severe.

section.title: FrostUtil/IsRefInOblivion
section.para: Whether or not the reference is in a base game or DLC Oblivion worldspace.

listitem.para: akReference: The object reference to check.

section.para: True if the reference is in Oblivion.
section.literallayout: ;Is the box in Oblivion? if IsRefInOblivion(Box) Debug.Trace("Box is in Oblivion!") endif
section.para: The following Worldspaces are considered Oblivion worldspaces: Soul Cairn Apocrypha

section.title: FrostUtil/GetPlayerWetness
section.para: Return the player's current wetness value.
None

section.title: FrostUtil/GetPlayerWetnessLevel
section.para: Return the player's current wetness level. May be easier to use than GetPlayerWetness() if you don't need to know the actual wetness value.
None
section.literallayout: ;Is the player drenched? int wet_level = FrostUtil.GetPlayerWetnessLevel() if wet_level == 3 debug.notification("You're soaked!") endif

section.title: FrostUtil/GetPlayerExposure
section.para: Return the player's current exposure value.
None
section.literallayout: ;Is the player cold? float exp = FrostUtil.GetPlayerExposure() if exp >= 40.0 debug.notification("Brrr!") endif

section.title: FrostUtil/GetPlayerExposureLevel
section.para: Return the player's current exposure level. May be easier to use than GetPlayerExposure() if you don't need to know the actual exposure value.
None
section.literallayout: ;Is the player cold? float exp_level = FrostUtil.GetPlayerExposureLevel() if exp_level >= 2 debug.notification("Brrr!") endif

section.title: FrostUtil/ModPlayerExposure
section.para: Modify the player's current exposure by the given amount. Using this function will correctly process the exposure change and notify the UI layer (meters, etc) of the change and display them as appropriate. Using this function is the only safe method of directly modifying the player's exposure value.
section.literallayout: function ModPlayerExposure(float amount, float limit = -1.0) global

listitem.para: amount: The amount to modify the player's exposure by. Positive numbers increase exposure, negative values decrease exposure.

limit (optional): The value at which you should stop the exposure change, if this value is reached. A value of -1.0 indicates that there is no limit. (Example: calling FrostUtil.ModPlayerExposure(35.0, 50.0) when the player's current exposure is 40.0 will increase the player's exposure to 50.0, not 75.0)

section.para: None
section.literallayout: ;The player did something that should make them warmer. FrostUtil.ModPlayerExposure(-15.0) ;The player did something that should make them warmer, but not below "Cold". FrostUtil.ModPlayerExposure(-15.0, 40.0) ;The player did something that should make them colder. FrostUtil.ModPlayerExposure(20.0) ;The player did something that should make them colder, but not above "Freezing". FrostUtil.ModPlayerExposure(20.0, 80.0)

section.title: FrostUtil/GetPlayerWarmth
section.para: Returns the player's total Warmth value.
None
The player's Warmth value.
section.literallayout: ;How bundled up is the player? int warmth = FrostUtil.GetPlayerWarmth()

section.title: FrostUtil/GetPlayerCoverage
section.para: Returns the player's total Coverage value.
None
The player's Coverage value.
section.literallayout: ;How covered is the player? int coverage = FrostUtil.GetPlayerCoverage()

section.title: FrostUtil/GetPlayerArmorWarmth
section.para: Returns the sum of the Warmth values of all gear worn by the player.
None
The total Warmth of all player worn gear.
section.literallayout: ;How warm are the player's clothes? int gear_warmth = FrostUtil.GetPlayerArmorWarmth()
section.para: There are many different sources of Warmth, so this function does not return the player's total Warmth value. If you want the total Warmth, use GetPlayerWarmth() instead.

section.title: FrostUtil/GetPlayerArmorCoverage
section.para: Returns the sum of the Coverage values of all gear worn by the player.
None
The total Coverage of all player worn gear.
section.literallayout: ;How warm are the player's clothes? int gear_coverage = FrostUtil.GetPlayerArmorCoverage()
section.para: There are many different sources of Coverage, so this function does not return the player's total Coverage value. If you want the total Coverage, use GetPlayerCoverage() instead.

section.title: FrostUtil/Frostfall_OnPlayerStartSwimming
section.para: An SKSE Mod Event that is raised when the player begins swimming.
None
section.literallayout:
Event OnInit() RegisterForModEvent("Frostfall_OnPlayerStartSwimming", "Frostfall_OnPlayerStartSwimming") endEvent
Event Frostfall_OnPlayerStartSwimming() debug.notification("The player started swimming!") endEvent

section.title: FrostUtil/Frostfall_OnPlayerStopSwimming
section.para: An SKSE Mod Event that is raised when the player stops swimming.
None
section.literallayout:
Event OnInit() RegisterForModEvent("Frostfall_OnPlayerStopSwimming", "Frostfall_OnPlayerStopSwimming") endEvent
Event Frostfall_OnPlayerStopSwimming() debug.notification("The player stopped swimming!") endEvent

section.title: FrostUtil/Frostfall_Loaded
section.para: An SKSE Mod Event that is raised when Frostfall is finished starting up, or after loading a save game with Frostfall enabled.
None
section.literallayout:
Event OnInit() RegisterForModEvent("Frostfall_Loaded", "Frostfall_Loaded") endEvent
Event Frostfall_Loaded() debug.notification("Frostfall has finished starting up!") endEvent
section.para: This event will only be raised if Frostfall is enabled. Therefore, don't rely on this event at game start-up for a critical function as you will not receive it until the player starts up Frostfall or loads a game with Frostfall already enabled.

section.title: FrostUtil/Frost_OnRescuePlayer
section.para: An SKSE Mod Event that is raised when the player is rescued when using the Max Exposure Rescue mechanic.

listitem.para: in_water: Whether or not the player was swimming when they were rescued (mainly used by the rescue system to select a suitable destination).

section.literallayout:
Event OnInit() RegisterForModEvent("Frost_OnRescuePlayer", "Frost_OnRescuePlayer") endEvent
Event Frost_OnRescuePlayer(bool in_water) debug.notification("The player was just rescued!") endEvent

section.title: FrostUtil/Frost_OnTamrielRegionChange
section.para: An SKSE Mod Event that is raised when the player moves from one tracked region to another.

listitem.para: region: The ID of the region. See Notes for region IDs.
in_region: If True, the player is entering this region. If False, the player is leaving it.

section.literallayout:
Event OnInit() RegisterForModEvent("Frost_OnTamrielRegionChange", "Frost_OnTamrielRegionChange") endEvent
Event Frost_OnTamrielRegionChange(int region, bool in_region) if in_region && region == 11 debug.notification("The player just entered Solstheim!") endif endEvent

section.title: FrostUtil/Frost_OnInnerFireMeditate
section.para: An SKSE Mod Event that is raised when the player begins or ends using the Inner Fire ability.

listitem.para: abMeditating: If True, the player entered the Inner Fire state. If False, they have just left it.

section.literallayout:
Event OnInit() RegisterForModEvent("Frost_OnInnerFireMeditate", "Frost_OnInnerFireMeditate") endEvent
